definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
Sun Jihai (1977-), Chinese footballer, played for Manchester City (2002-2008)
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
Sun Yue (1973-), PRC female pop star/Sun Yue (1985-), PRC basketball star
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]/Son Goku, the main character in Dragon Ball 七龍珠|七龙珠[Qi1 long2 zhu1]
daughter's son/grandson/descendant via the female line
eldest grandson/the eldest son of one's eldest son
eldest grandson/the eldest son of one's eldest son
the original name of 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1], Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3]
descendants of the Fiery Emperor and the Yellow Emperor (i.e. Han Chinese people)

sentences.english: Then he rushed into Mr Sun's kitchen to save her.
sentences.chinese: 然后他冲进孙奶奶家的厨房去救她。

sentences.english: Sun Weide, spokesman for the Beijing Olympic Organizing Committee, has urged that the Games not be politicized.
sentences.chinese: 北京奥组委发言人孙维德呼吁不要将奥运会政治化。

sentences.english: Li Bai is the descendent of Li Chong'er, grandson of Li Hao, King Liang Wuzhao.
sentences.chinese: 李白为凉式昭王李暠之孙李重耳的后裔。

sentences.english: Sun, the Lehman Brothers economist, says as manufacturers are pushed to the brink, China's stock markets could see sharp declines.
sentences.chinese: 孙明春表示，制造商被推倒悬崖边缘，中国股市大跌。

sentences.english: Foxconn did not go into the details surrounding Sun's death.
sentences.chinese: 富士康没有对孙的死亡做详细的解释。

sentences.english: In tears, Sun promised he would dw so.
sentences.chinese: 在流泪，孙答应他会干重等。

sentences.english: And Mr Sun is scaling down his deposit-taking operation, restricting it now to company workers.
sentences.chinese: 孙也将吸收存款控制在公司内部的员工之间。

sentences.english: The book that Mt. Sun wrote is the best book in the world.
sentences.chinese: 孙老师写的书是世界上最好的书。

sentences.english: The two trends of overthrowing Sun Yat-sen were merely a fuse of reorganization Restoration League.
sentences.chinese: 二次“倒孙风潮”不过是光复会重组的导火线而已。

sentences.english: The Bureau Chief Sun voice just fell, the scene fan erupts the warm applause.
sentences.chinese: 孙局长的话音刚落，现场的球迷就爆发出热烈的掌声。

sentences.english: Sun`s back to parking his car in front of the teaching building.
sentences.chinese: 孙重新把车停在教学楼前面了。

sentences.english: Her native language is Mandarin and she is fluent in English.
sentences.chinese: 孙律师母语为普通话，并精通英语。

sentences.english: Sun said nothing and smiled weakly, feeling a bit embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 孙没有说话，只是回上轻轻一笑，略觉尴尬。

sentences.english: Tiger to play SunTieJun capable DE law wind asked task.
sentences.chinese: 虎一帆也给孙铁军打德律风问了问任务的事。

sentences.english: Sun rushed to help her， only to find her clothes on the ground. She had disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 孙公子要去扶她，只见衣服在地上，人早没影了。

sentences.english: Mr. Sun goes to a week.
sentences.chinese: 孙老师一周去看望他爷爷两次。

definition: Zheng state during the Warring States period/surname Zheng/abbr. for 鄭州|郑州[Zheng4 zhou1]
(classical) a type of battle-ax/to kill/to slaughter
pitchpipe, pitch standard, one of the twelve semitones in the traditional tone system
surname Zou/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC) in the southeast of Shandong Province
non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
surname Wu/area comprising southern Jiangsu, northern Zhejiang and Shanghai/name of states in Southern China at different historical periods
surname Zhao/one of the seven states during the Warring States Period (476-220 BC)/the Former Zhao 前趙 (304-329) and Later Zhao 後趙 (319-350), states of the Sixteen Kingdoms
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
